candidate_text: "Possessed" (also translated as "The Demons" or "The Devils") is a novel written by Russian literary giant Fyodor Dostoevsky, published in 1872.
The story revolves around the destructive influence of revolutionary ideologies on individuals and society.
The book is considered one of the greatest novels of all time and a masterpiece of psychological fiction.
The story revolves around the life of Stepan Trofimovich Verkhovensky, a liberal intellectual and his son Nikolai Vsevolodovich Stavrogin, who returns to their hometown after many years away.
The book is a sprawling tale of politics, philosophy, and psychological insight that explores the themes of revolution, nihilism, and the search for meaning.
The book is considered one of his most important and complex works.
The book is a psychological and philosophical exploration of the human condition, politics, morality, and the search for meaning.
